author: Marco Mirabella
title: Ensuro: A Decentralized Insurance
description: Insurance is hardly present where most needed, as in developing countries, and is unavailable as an investment product for ordinary people.

assessments.note: This proposal, if implemented, has enormous potential to drive adoption as outlined.

This proposal is a great implementation that mesh the cardano blockchain with the customer needs from any point of view. The proposal clearly articulates how it will add value to the Cardano ecosystem and for the stakeholders (in detail for insurer, investors and insurance company)

This proposal yields an impact score of 3 because it highlights a critical area of need but it is not clear how the value will be provided to end users by the end of this calendar year. The value to end users appears to come not until 2022. The application, according to the proposal's calendar, will launch in Q4 in 2021 which means that the liquidity pool will begin to be created and some people may apply for insurance products through ensuro at that time.
assessments.reply: The comment is conflicting, in the first part it says that we are not specifing how we will provide value to the end users, but then it says that according to the proposal we will provide value by Q4 2021.

assessments.note: I love this proposal tackling the shadiest industry on the planet. I am all sold on this economic model of staking and believe that the proposal will create serious traction for Cardano in greater community. The budget is more than humble and I hope to see this proposer come back for more again and again..
This proposal addresses Cardano Fund 5: DApps & Integrations Challenge. The project proposal is solid and can bring a lot of value to the Cardano ecosystem.

This is a well-founded concept and offers both an investment and customer service dimension that would bring value to different users of the solution.      

Two components of the solution are outlined, but a third component will likely be needed to address insurance customer claims.   

Parametric insurance will depend heavily on external, real-world data.  This should be highlighted more deeply in solution and implementation / roadmap planning.

The concept of modularized risk modeling is a great foundation to build and differentiate your services.  Would respectfully suggest a more reasonable initial product / prototype would be organized around a single risk model to improve focus and to position for iterative learning.
assessments.reply: Very detailed feedback, it addresses the strenghts and the weekness of our proposal and gave practical action items to improve it

assessments.note: The team's credentials are outstanding. A big plus for confidence is the Binance hackathon award.

The proposer provides a step-by-step plan for the implementation with clear milestones and a defined time horizon. The only thing I miss in this area is that the proposer has not mentioned possible difficulties and how to deal with them.
Further I think it's important to improve details about the process related to the issue and purchase of the policy and subsequent monitoring of that, because in some countries there are some limitations that don't allow these kind of services.
assessments.reply: Good feedback. It brings a good reasoning behind the score and a way to improve

assessments.note: Again, insurance is a critical area of need but I do not see within this proposal a description of the specific insurance products, an understanding of the insurance regulations in the African nations, data or details about actuarial evaluations or risk assessments that would go into development and implementation of an insurance app. The proposal mainly asks for salaries of employees with no clear outline of what tasks each of those employees will accomplish in 2021.
assessments.reply: The reviewer didn't read in detail the full proposal. The goal of Ensuro is to create a framework that enable the creation of parametric insurance products and it not focused on a single application

assessments.note: technically, this demanding project may be able to be implemented. the market environment is interesting and difficult at the same time.

This is a complex business. The proposers don't specifically have insurance domain experience. 2 big questions. Normally insurance companies invest the float (premiums received) in risk assets. How will you compete when only holding capital in stable coins? As you are underwriting ratehr than directly writing insurance, how will you get to countries where insurance is not provided (as per the problem statement?)

A tiny team of 4 extraordinary people can change history of  Incentivised Solidarity. I can see many applications for the economic model and integrations of Ensuro with other Dapps such as decentralised Realestate, ridesharing, worker unions.. I feel the team is creative and acomplished enough to take this project way beyond the current proposal very successfully.
assessments.reply: This review brought joy to the entire team, it motivates us to create a product that will be hopefuly useful to many people

assessments.note: It is likely for this proposal to be implemented because it has a strong core team and a simple strategy to build an assurance product on top of the Cardano ecosystem.

The liquidity pool concept is innovative and has great promise, but the "payout" side of the insurance product is not well-described.  It is therefore difficult to assess the chances of overall success.  Blockchain technology offers great opportunity through network effects, so a lens on the consuming consumer community in the proposal would help reinforce the promise of the overall business model.

The proposal's listed three main goals address the challenge sufficiently. The estimated roadmap and budget allocation make this proposal appear feasible.

The information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal.

The proposal team is completed skilled and have a good tradeof of business and technical knowledge, so in my opinion will able to make surely a good pilot or MVP (I have 20 years experienced in information technology related to financial services industry). The proposal offers a realistic timetable to complete the work. 	The proposer has considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation

Auditability score = 2 because there are no KPIs listed in the proposal. There are a few targets in the time horizon so we could audit whether or not the team completed those tasks but extent of the success would not be possible to know. For example, they identify creating a partnership with 3MGAs or white label risk model providers from different sectors. So we could audit the number of partnerships they have created but I would not know how to assess the suitability of those partnerships.

There are many issues which may impact the feasibility of this proposal. How are they funding compliance and reporting to meet solvency? How are they marketing to insurers to sell their underwriting? How do they reach underserved consumers when they are not actually dealing with them? How are they managing their float?
assessments.reply: The point mentioned in the comment of the reviewer are contained in the proposal or they are part of the response we gave to two of the comments brought by the community under our application

assessments.note: Yes proposal is superbly detailed and backed by achievements in the past that make al the difference and will be very conscientious in performance feedback.
The description provided in the Roadmap is sufficient to track and audit the project progress.

Given that 6 months of funding is requested, it's assumed that the Q2 & Q3 milestones are most relevant.  These are clearly and reasonably laid out and form a good, measurable basis for the funding request.

It's suggested that proposed Q4 deliverables are not clear or achievable and that a Q4 "regroup" and learning / evolution phase would be valuable to set out the next phase of product evolution and deployment.

The proposal would drive greater confidence in success if the actual development milestones were outlined.  Proposal does a good job of outlining project outcomes, but project deliverables are not clear enough to support auditing and progress measurement.

solution: Create a decentralized liquidity pool that acts as an insurance fund to back up parametric insurance products.
experience: C-suite comes from Venture Capital, Blockchain (Layer2), 25yr+ Software Development, PhD Mathematics, Ms Physics, Financial Risk Management.
